text:
Been going around SG trying to hunt for my best childhood taste & so far, none can beat this shop's oyster cake yet.

It's crispy on the outside, soft & meaty & full of wholesome goodness inside without too much flour or oil meshed up within the fillings.
Since I don't really like oysters, the prawn & pork substitute is equally satisfying üíû

Even though I'm weight conscious, biting into this didn't feel as bad as those temporary set up stalls selling hard & cold fried pancakes. Each time I passes by, they are always ready with a few hot or warm crispy crusty fried pancakes. I'm quite sure this is 1 of the best in Singapore.

So glad I can cycle there to get it whenever I have the craving.

Go go go 6th Floor oyster Cake!!!! üòçüåπüí™üí™üí™

Not many stalls sells this oyster cake nowadays,hard to find.I like the generous fillings of oyster meat,minced pork ,onion leeks & peanuts in every mouthful.tasty,comfort food.price is reasonable,starts from $3.70 /PC to $4.20 w/scallops.btw the chili they provide is nice ,not spicy

The filling is a good amount with minced pork, oysters and shrimp, I'm a fan of the taste. Kinda hefty, eating 2 will fill me up. The kimchi one was also good but it's not available the last two times I went.
Multiple times purchasing. It's the best oyster cake I have tried. Was served hot. Fillings were generous. The chilli was flavourful too! They r having a promotion of 3 for $10.

Ordered a portion of fried oyster to try, it's delicious. The meat is very juicy while the outside layer is very crispy, the item is also freshly made and have good quality. I heard of the chilli that is very spicy and fragrant, however when I was given the item, it does not come with the chilli. I request for the chilli, and the staff gives me a look of annoyed, I was surprised that they don't give chilli with a portion of oyster..
